settings.heading: Aromatic Journey Of Making Mishri Gulkand

settings.description: Our farmers carefully harvest the Indian Damask roses before the sun rises. They start their day at 4 AM, plucking the roses before the sun to shield their aroma and goodness.
Indulge in the sweetness of Mishri with our delicious gulkand. This ancient ingredient has been used for ages as a mood enhancer, natural mouth freshener, and energy booster.

With delicate care, the rural women layer fragrant rose petals and mishri in earthen pots. Next, the mixture is slow-cooked for a month under the sun between 10 AM and 4 PM. This traditional process preserves nutrients, flavour, and the heavenly aroma of the roses.

settings.title: Obtaining Ghee
settings.description: The churning yields makkhan, which is then heated on a low flame to obtain golden ghee.

settings.title: Curb Your Sweet Cravings
settings.description: Satisfy Your Sweet Tooth with Mishri Gulkand

settings.title: Traditional Rose Delicacy
settings.description: It's a timeless summer delicacy made with the finest Damask roses and Dhaagewali Mishri.

settings.title: Mishri Gulkand Remedy for a Healthier Gut
settings.description: Gulkand is known to help improve gut-related issues like acidity and digestion.

settings.heading: Our Founder's Guide On Ways To Enjoy Gulkand!

settings.title: Have it spoonful directly from the jar
settings.description: First thing in the morning or as a post-meal dessert

settings.title: Prepare rose sharbat by mixing it in water
settings.description: To experience a refreshing summer coolant and digestive tonic in one

settings.title: Mix it in milk
settings.description: Drink it before bed for sound sleep

settings.title: Add Mishri Gulkand to your diet

settings.heading: What are the gulkand highlights?
settings.row_content: Carefully selected fresh Rose petals of a particular medicinally effective Damask rose species which grows in the middle of the year for a few months only. It is prepared under natural sun heat that imparts its taste and efficacy. No artificial heating is applied to preserve its maximum potency.

settings.heading: How to consume gulkand?
settings.row_content: Gulkand can be consumed in ½ tsp portions post Dinner and lunch. In addition, 1 tsp can be mixed with lukewarm milk at bedtime, easing the sleeping problems.

settings.heading: What are gulkand side effects?
settings.row_content:
Gulkand may cause headaches and early greying of hair.
Rock sugar is used in traditional recipes. In gulkand, the percentage of Rock sugar is around 55-70 %. Hence, Gulkand comes under a high glycemic index group of food.

settings.heading: Is gulkand good for health?
settings.row_content: Yes, gulkand is good for health and may help with brain disorders, improve respiratory function, enhance cardiovascular function, fight against bacterial infections, act as an antioxidant and reduce inflammation.

settings.heading: What precautions are to be taken while having gulkand?
settings.row_content:
If you have chronic build-up or discharge of mucous in your nose or throat and swelling in the mucous membrane, you must be cautious before consuming gulkand.
Pregnant and lactating mothers and elderly individuals shall take precautions before having gulkand.
It is not recommended for Diabetic and insulin-resistant patients.
